Sequence Information.Source: Synthetic construct(derived from HCV NS3 helicase protein)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.18479669]Hepatitis C virus (HCV):inhibition of HCV helicase activity(IC50=0.2±0.01 μM);West Nile virus (WNV):inhibition of WNV helicase activity(IC50=2.7±0.3 μM);Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV):inhibition of JEV helicase activity(IC50=21.1±2.2 μM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: The intact enzymatic properties of NS3 are necessary for the virus propagation,which possesses numerous enzymatic activities including RNA stimulated nucleoside triphosphatase (NTPase) and RNA helicase activities. The peptides inhibited the NTPase/helicase by a direct interaction with the enzyme highly probably by a competitive mechanism.

Literature.Title: Viral NS3 helicase activity is inhibited by peptides reproducing the Arg-rich conserved motif of the enzyme (motif VI).
Literature.Author: Borowski P, Heising MV, Miranda IB, Liao CL, Choe J, Baier A.
